text: A marriage legally entered into in another jurisdiction between 2 persons of the same sex that is recognized as valid in that jurisdiction, that is not expressly prohibited by §§ 46-401.01 through 46-404, and has not been deemed illegal under § 46-405, shall be recognized as a marriage in the District.
historical:
Effect of Amendments

D.C. Law 18-110 substituted "§§ 46-401.01" for "§§ 46-401".

Legislative History of Laws

For Law 18-9, see notes following § 46-401.

For Law 18-110, see notes following § 46-401.

DC CODE § 46-405.01

Current through December 11, 2012

heading.catch_text: Recognition of Marriages from Other Jurisdictions.
